name: Clams in Oyster Sauce
author: lola
summary: Clams, such as Manila or baby clams, taste great cooked in oyster sauce, and make a great Filipino appetizer.
ingredients: 1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated
2 ¼ pounds clams in shell, scrubbed
directions: Heat the oil in a large pot with a lid over medium heat
Cook the onion and garlic in the hot oil until fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes
Add the ginger to the mixture and cook another 2 minutes
Stir the oyster sauce into the mixture; cover and cook another 2 minutes
Pour the water into the mixture, cover, and cook another 2 minutes
Add the clams; cover and cook until the majority of the clams have opened, about 5 minutes
Discard any clams which do not open
